<<<<<<< HEAD
A monumental memorial of marine mercy being an acknowledgement of an high hand of Divine deliverance on the deep in the time of distress, in a late voyage from Boston in New-England to London, anno 1683. : In a poem. / By Richard Steere. ; To which is added another occasioned by several remarkable passages happening at the birth of a male child on board the same ship in her voyage returning 1684. By the same author then a passenger. Steere, Richard, 1643-1721.
[4], 12 p. : ill.
Printed at Boston in New-England by Richard Pierce for James Cowse stationer, [Boston] : anno 1684.
Reproduction of original in the Massachusetts Historical Society Library.
=======

By the same author then a passenger. Steere, Richard, 1643-1721.
[4], 12 p. : ill.
Printed at Boston in New-England by Richard Pierce for James Cowse stationer, [Boston] : anno 1684.
Reproduction of original in the Massachusetts Historical Society Library.
James Cowse stationer
Richard Pierce
Boston in New-England
